recommendations.title: Migrate to AWS Free Tier for EC2
recommendations.description: Utilize the AWS Free Tier for EC2 to reduce costs. This includes 750 hours of Linux/Unix usage per month.
steps: Stop and terminate all EC2 instances
Create a new EC2 instance using the AWS Free Tier
Migrate applications to the new EC2 instance

recommendations.title: Migrate to AWS Free Tier for RDS
recommendations.description: Utilize the AWS Free Tier for RDS to reduce costs. This includes 750 hours of usage per month.
steps: Stop and terminate all RDS instances
Create a new RDS instance using the AWS Free Tier
Migrate databases to the new RDS instance

recommendations.title: Use PostgreSQL as an Open-Source Alternative
recommendations.description: Use PostgreSQL as an open-source alternative to RDS. This can be self-hosted on-premises or in the cloud.
steps: Install PostgreSQL on a self-hosted server

recommendations.title: Use DigitalOcean as an Alternative Provider
recommendations.description: Use DigitalOcean as an alternative provider for EC2. This can provide cost savings and improved performance.

recommendations.title: Right-Size EC2 Instances
recommendations.description: Right-size EC2 instances to reduce costs. This includes using smaller instance types and optimizing resource utilization.
steps: Monitor and adjust instance sizes as needed

recommendations.title: Use Reserved Instances for EC2
recommendations.description: Use reserved instances for EC2 to reduce costs. This includes committing to a 1-year or 3-year term.
steps: Commit to a reserved instance term

recommendations.title: Use Serverless Computing for Lambda
recommendations.description: Use serverless computing for Lambda to reduce costs. This includes using AWS Lambda functions and optimizing resource utilization.
steps: Monitor and adjust resource utilization as needed

recommendations.title: Optimize Data Transfer Costs
recommendations.description: Optimize data transfer costs by reducing data transfer volumes and using cost-effective transfer options.
